clinical_study.brief_title: A Post-market Observational Study With the easyEndoTM Universal Linear Cutting Stapler in Standard Laparoscopic and Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB) Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market Observational Study With the easyEndoTM Universal Linear Cutting Stapler in Standard Laparoscopic and Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB) Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this observational registry is to evaluate the safety of the easyEndoTM Universal Linear Cutting Stapler and reloads from Ezisurg Medical when used to create anastomoses during standard and robot-assisted laparoscopic Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB) surgery. Stapler performance during surgery as well as post-operative pain and the clinical efficacy of the procedures will be determined as secondary objectives.

primary_outcome.description: Number of conversions to laparotomy during the index procedure

primary_outcome.measure: Safety - Length of stay at the intensive care unit
primary_outcome.description: Number of days at the intensive care unit after the index procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety - Length of stay in the hospital by the modified Post-Anesthesia Discharge Scoring System (PADSS)
primary_outcome.description: The Modified PADSS guarantees safe discharge. PADSS is based on the assessment of 6 criteria: vital signs (including blood pressure, pulse, temperature and respiratory rate), ambulation, nausea / vomiting, pain, surgical bleeding and fluid intake / output. Each criterion is given a score from 0 to 2. Patients scoring ≥ 9 are considered fit for discharge, provided that the score for vital signs is not lower than 2 and that none of the other five criteria is 0, even if the total score reaches 9.

primary_outcome.description: Number of re-interventions and number of participants with (serious) adverse events ≥ grade II Clavien-Dindo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Device performance - Technical success of the surgical procedure performed with the device
secondary_outcome.description: Number of procedures with technical success defined as bariatric surgery as intended, without technical difficulties and without conversion to laparotomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Device performance - Scoring of operator satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: Scoring of: easy of intra-abdominal device positioning, grasping/climbing force, sharpness of the blades, staple-line formation, device stability, device maneuverability, battery power, device consistency and reliability, ergonomic design, hemostasis. Each of the aforementioned items receives a score from 0 to 4, with 0 indicating that the user is very unsatisfied and 4 indicating that the user is very satisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative pain by means of the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of acute post-operative abdominal pain by means of the VAS, which contains a 0 to 100 grading scale with 0 equaling no pain and 100 equaling the worst conceivable pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative food tolerance by means of the food tolerance questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Food tolerance by means of the food tolerance questionnaire. The food tolerance questionnaire allows to score the patients' satisfaction regarding food intake and food tolerance after bariatric surgery. The patients' interpretation of food intake is scored between 1 (very poor) and 5 (excellent). A cumulative score, varying between 1 and 27 is derived, with 27 representing an excellent food tolerance.

study_pop.textblock: Obese patients eligible for standard laparoscopic or robot-assisted laparoscopic RYGB surgery. This registry will collect data from 150 laparoscopic RYGB procedures in which anastomoses are created with the easyEndoTM Universal Linear Cutting Stapler and reloads (Ezisurg Medical).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient ≥ 18 years of age at study entry.
- Patient and investigator signed and dated the informed consent form prior to the index-procedure.
- Patient has a BMI ≥ 35 kg/m2 with one or more related co-morbidity.
- Patient has a BMI ≥ 40 kg/m2.
- Patient is eligible for standard laparoscopic or for robotic-assisted laparoscopic RYGB surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is unable / unwilling to provide informed consent.
- Patient has a history of bariatric surgery.
- Patient is unable to comply with the study protocol or proposed follow-up visits.
- Patient has a contra-indication for standard laparoscopic or robot-assisted laparoscopic RYGB surgery.
